msItem.rubric: Explanatio qualiter facillime inueniuntur que queruntur in quarta parte pantheologi secundum nouum modum scilicet per litteras alphabeti
msItem.incipit: Quia per capitula que primitus ante initium
msItem.title: An alphabetical table for the following work
msItem.note: Presented as ‘new’ in this headnote explaining its use and directing the user to a system explained in part 4. The table is fuller than the MS, which contains only five books; here contents references extend through to the end of book 13. The ‘new’ contents system represented by this item has been superimposed upon another displayed in the volume, a list of chapters by book and number in text order; this follows the prologue (fols. 10va–13rb), presented in four columns to the page (and again running through book 13). And each book ends by repeating this information for that section of the text.

msItem.note: see Sharpe, no. 1174 (425–6, with further references). The final column has only seven lines (and is only ruled for such, although the entire page has been bounded); the remainder of the book is blank, with traces of washed texts (added s. xiv1) on fols. 178v and 179v. Fol. 180 is a former pastedown, with the rubricator’s notes of totals of letters and paraphs supplied (cut off) at the foot.

At least two large omissions have been supplied by a later hand at the page foot, on fols. 46v and 86v–7. These are among a number of signs that the MS may not have been copied consecutively and that there were problems adjusting boundaries between production units.

supportDesc.extent: Fols. iv (numbered fols. i–iii, 1) + 179 (numbered fols. 2–180) + iii (numbered fols. iv–vi). 335 242

collation.formula: 16 28(–1, its stub showing before the flyleaf, fol. 1) 3–228 238(–5, –6, both stubs, probably blank).
collation.signatures: Signed on the last leaves of quires, both by the scribe in roman numerals and a later hand, using brown crayon, in arabic. Catchwords and signatures have occasionally been cut away, but originally quires 2–22 = Ius–xxj, 1–21. Also at the lower edges of final versos, the rubricator’s count of paraphs and letters supplied.

layoutDesc.layout: (a) quires 2–7 (fols. 8–54v) are in double columns, each column 245 74 , with 10 mm between columns, in 46 lines to the column.
(b) the remainder also in double columns, but each of these 248 74–6 , with 10 mm between columns, in 53 lines to the column.
Prickings often survive; bounded and ruled in brown and black ink.

handDesc.handNote: Written in gothic textura quadrata, above the top line; in spite of the format shift, the same hand throughout. Punctuation by point and punctus elevatus.

decoDesc.decoNote: At book divisions, 8- to 12-line red and blue arabesque capitals with vine infills in red, blue, and green.
Two-line arabesque capitals at chapter divisions, alternating green on red flourishing, red on blue flourishing, and blue on red flourishing.
Sporadic 1-line red arabesque capitals within chapters.
Chapter lists at the end of each book have entries introduced by alternate 1-line green, red, and blue capitals.
Running titles with the book number in text ink; frequent marginal indications of authorities.
In the table at the head, frequent leaf line-fillers on fol. 3rb and some extended penwork flourishing in text ink and red at the page foot.
Fol. 77va, apparently to fill a break in the text, has a rectangular vine and flower design in the three colours.

binding.p: A modern replacement. Sewn on five thongs. At the front, a marbled paper leaf, two modern paper flyleaves, and a medieval vellum flyleaf (fol. 1, half a bifolium, preceded by two stubs, one its conjugate); at the rear, two modern paper flyleaves and another marbled paper leaf (iv–vi).

history.provenance: ‘Hic liber est beati thome Martiris De Lesnes quem qui eum abstulerit aut super eo fraudem fecerit fit anathema Maranata’ (fol. 2, the lower margin; s. xiii ex.) (Ker, MLGB 114).
Two notes on the text and its author (fol. iv, s. xvii).
